content: length stitch count 44 48 50 52 54 56 58 60 60 62 62 64 54 56 58 60 64 66 68 70 72 72 trim switch to smaller needles rib setup *kl p1 repeat from * around rib stitch *k1bl p1 repeat from * around work rib stitch for approximately 2 /5cm bobble loosely break yarn weave in ends repeat above steps for the second sleeve wash and block jumper to fit 12 plumose laura barkla yoke chart a mc cc slip_stitch purlwise with yarn in back first step of inv-l second step of inv-r second step of inv-l - pick up left leg of stitch below slipped stitch knit lifted stitch first step of inv-r pick up right leg of stitch below the next stitch to be worked knit lifted stitch important note you are strongly advised to work round 1 with extra slack in the cc yarn if you don t the floats may be pulled too tight by the round 2 increases which can cause puckering 13 plumose laura barkla yoke chart b mc cc slip_stitch purlwise with yarn in back first step of inv-l second step of inv-r second step of inv-l - pick up left leg of stitch below slipped stitch knit lifted stitch first step of inv-r pick up right leg of stitch below the next stitch to be worked knit lifted stitch 14 plumose laura barkla colourwork tips - the chart is read bottom-up and right-to-left begin at the bottom-right corner knit from right to left and then return to the right side of the chart when you reach the next round - many knitters find their stranded knitting is tighter than their stockinette it s important to keep the yoke the same gauge as the body so consider going up a needle size during the stranding if you have this problem - hold the cc white as the dominant colour throughout see useful resources for more information on colour dominance useful resources åsa tricosa german short row https //asatricosa com/german-short-row/ jennifer steingass here s how i knit the invisible increases inv-l … https //www instagram com/p/bbfo30sfbdi/ hl=en tin can knits german short row https //blog tincanknits com/2015/05/14/german- short-row/ tin can knits how to knit fair isle patterns https //blog tincanknits com/2015/05/26/how-to-knit-fair-isle/ ysolda teague colour dominance https //ysolda com/blogs/journal/colour-dominance 15 plumose laura barkla
